fields.description:
Cloned a Linux kernel repo from elsewhere. Created a new Bitbucket repo to hold changes to it.  Got this on the initial push to Bitbucket:

{code}
#!

mitydsp$ git remote add origin https://dbeal@bitbucket.org/cp-lighting/acuity-controller-linux-critical-link.git
mitydsp$ git push -u origin --all
Password: 
Counting objects: 2320401, done.
Delta compression using up to 2 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (373955/373955), done.
Writing objects: 100% (2320401/2320401), 443.80 MiB | 1.14 MiB/s, done.
Total 2320401 (delta 1941133), reused 2292256 (delta 1924091)
error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 502
{code}

Tried it again after deleting and recreating the Bitbucket repo.  Same result.  Also tried importing the source repo directly into a new Bitbucket repo.  That also failed.
fields.summary: Initial push of repo fails with "error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 502"

fields.description:
Hey,\\
please can you change the links in the dashboard in a way that the username/teamname links to the userpage or the team site and just the repository links to the repository itself.\\
!3451060762-Selection_029.jpg|thumbnail!

Thanks and greetings\\
Leo
fields.summary: Links in the Dashboard

fields.description:
Hey,\\
i like the feature that i can get emails for all kind of activities on bitbucket. New pushes, new commits, tickets, ... . Sadly i cannot filter them in my email client because they have no id.

It would be awesome of you if you could add {{X-Bitbucket-Repository}}, {{X-Bitbucket-Type}}, ... to the email header so my filters would allow me to store them in there own folders locally.

Github alredy does that:

{code}
Message-ID: <contao/core/issues/7067/45094007@github.com>
In-Reply-To: <contao/core/issues/7067@github.com>
References: <contao/core/issues/7067@github.com>
Subject: Re: [core] Delete "confirm" is empty (#7067)
Mime-Version: 1.0
Precedence: list
X-GitHub-Recipient: LeoUnglaub
X-GitHub-Reason: author
List-ID: contao/core <core.contao.github.com>
List-Archive: https://github.com/contao/core
List-Post: <mailto:reply+i-34768808-5b1dd65840983fec24360ac49fc7b7dbae728231-734684@reply.github.com>
List-Unsubscribe: <mailto:unsub+i-34768808-5b1dd65840983fec24360ac49fc7b7dbae728231-734684@reply.github.com>,
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/734684__eyJzY29wZSI6Ik5ld3NpZXM6TXV0ZSIsImV4cGlyZXMiOjE3MTc1MDk3NDMsImRhdGEiOnsiaWQiOjMzNjE1NDcxfX0=--a76fea7f7fc0acf431d8ae19df0ab728ef3a06b0>
X-Auto-Response-Suppress: All
X-GitHub-Recipient-Address: leo@leo-unglaub.net
{code}

Thanks and greetings\\
Leo
fields.summary: Adding additional header fields to bitbucket mails (BB-10739)

fields.description:
With the new UI, there is no longer any navigation for accessing a repository's admin settings page. There used to be a little gear icon, but that has been removed. If you create a new empty repo there is no way to access the settings page unless you manually enter the URL (e.g. bitbucket.org/username/repo-name/admin). Once you have code in the repo, there is a share button in the top right corner of the overview page and through that you can find your way to the access management page by going to the "Repository" tab and clicking "Manage this repository," which takes you to the access management page. This is very convoluted and not at all obvious, nor helpful when the repo is still empty.

There was a case recently where my colleague created a new empty repo and realised he had created it under his personal account instead of the company account and needed to transfer it before we could grant access to the right people. It took two of us 20 minutes to figure out how to simply access the settings page where the transfer option can be found.

Seems to me there should be a "Settings" link under "Navigation" on the left - that makes the most sense to me.
fields.summary: No navigation to access repository settings

fields.description:
Hi, before the change to the new bitbucket interface I had created a wiki on a branch in my repository, but now the wiki is gone. So I need to know if the information is lost for ever or it is posible to recover them.

Thanks.
fields.summary: New interface delete my wiki on branch

fields.description:
It can be very helpful considering there's no way to revert delete operation.

GitHub force users to enter repo name in input field, this is overmuch. But I *should see* what repository I deleting.

Please see attached screenshots, fix is as simple possible :)
fields.summary: Specify repository name on deleting page. (BB-10737)

fields.description:
I noticed that hook is activated avery time a comment is added even if hook has unchecked comments option. Also even if all three options are unchecked hook is triggered on new pull request, new comment.\\
I made simple script for jenkins which posts FAIL/SUCCESS comment after a test, and get into loop because of that problem.

!2919707112-Screenshot%20from%202014-06-04%2013%3A01%3A19.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pull request POST hook fires no matter what is selected (BB-10740)

fields.description:
I have a team using git-flow on a project.

We create a feature/ branch from develop.

Later the branch is pushed to origin (so we can create a pull request, which we use for code review).

This new branch always has a merge target of "master" in the web interface.  When creating the pull request, it also uses target "master".

Since the feature was branched from develop, the default target for merge/pull requests should be develop?
fields.summary: Git-Flow Features merge to master by default (should be develop)

fields.description: No repository settings button
fields.summary: No settings button

fields.description:
The Download button on the main repo page is not functioning for me. I searched the issues and came up with BCLOUD-5692 . Since the original author didn't reply and i cannot reopen that issue again, i'll open this one instead.\\
Problem:\\
Download Button has some kind of gui glitch. It doesn't show anything to me instead of a gray bar.\\
Expected:\\
See some kind of download option or get some kind of default download.\\
Reality:\\
Just a gray bar apears under the download button.

Tested on Fedora Linux 20 fully patched.

Browsers used:

Google Chrome 35.0.1916.114

Mozilla Firefox 29.0.1 (with extensions NoScript and Ghostery but fully unblocked the Bitbucket URIs)

I've recorded a small screencast to demonstrate the problem. I'll attach it to this issue
fields.summary: Download Button is not functioning on the repository main view

fields.description: Compared to that produced by GitHub, GitLab, etc, the rendered HTML from Markdown etc. currently on BitBucket looks bad.  It looks almost like pure HTML without any polish: dense, long-lines, especially hard for the eyes.  Please provide a decent CSS for rendering HTML generated from Markdown etc.
fields.summary: Improve CSS for rendering HTML generated from Markdown etc. (BB-10745)

fields.description: If you are using Bitbucket's CNAME, creating a branch doesn't work, and you get the attached error message.
fields.summary: Creating a Branch doesn't work when using CNAME (BB-10741)

fields.description:
I post it on behalf of Japanese customer.

He hope to pay with JCB credit card, and want you to improve order form UI.\\
When he filled his credit card number of JCB in order form, he couldn't found easily errors happened.

I'll show you what happens customer fills JCB card number in order form.
fields.summary: Hope to pay with JCB credit card. (BB-10742)

fields.description: It is better to place a "View Next Button" on the Commits View Page.
fields.summary: View Next Button for Commits View Page (BB-10738)

fields.description: Can't find a Delete button inside a repo. Now I can't delete a repo in Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Can't find the Delete button inside a repo

fields.description: If the built-in editor for README.md is used to create a new file, its line endings are corrupted (using MS-DOS carriage returns from the 1980's). Please change this so proper end-of-line encoding is used.
fields.summary: Web-based README editor creates MS-DOS-style carriage returns (BB-10607)

fields.description:
I have followed the instructions on the OMPL website and installed all the packages required for the OMPLapp. I am a complete noob when it comes to Linux Ubuntu. I run the cmake ../.. command and I get this. I have Python 2.7.6 installed.

jordan@ubuntu:~/Desktop/omplapp-0.14.2-Source/build/Release$ cmake ../..\\
-- The CXX compiler identification is unknown\\
CMake Error: your CXX compiler: "CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER-NOTFOUND" was not found.   Please set CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER to a valid compiler path or name.\\
-- Building RelWithDebInfo\\
-- Boost version: 1.54.0\\
-- Found the following Boost libraries:\\
--   date_time\\
--   thread\\
--   serialization\\
--   filesystem\\
--   system\\
--   program_options\\
--   unit_test_framework\\
--   chrono\\
-- Boost version: 1.54.0\\
-- Found the following Boost libraries:\\
--   python\\
-- checking for module 'ccd>=2.0'\\
--   package 'ccd>=2.0' not found\\
-- checking for module 'fcl>=0.3.1'\\
--   package 'fcl>=0.3.1' not found\\
-- CCD library not found.  Will download and compile.\\
-- FCL library not found.  Will download and compile.\\
-- checking for module 'assimp'\\
--   found assimp, version 3.0.1264\\
-- Boost version: 1.54.0\\
-- Found the following Boost libraries:\\
--   python\\
-- Boost version: 1.54.0\\
-- Found the following Boost libraries:\\
--   python\\
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!\\
See also "/home/jordan/Desktop/omplapp-0.14.2-Source/build/Release/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".\\
See also "/home/jordan/Desktop/omplapp-0.14.2-Source/build/Release/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".

As far as I can tell I have the compiler present in the cmake folder in the Release folder. I have also downloaded cmake-2.8.12.2 from the cmake website but this seems redundant to the 2.8.12.2 folder that came with OMPL. Also, I'm not sure if the CCD and FCL libraries that are not being found are related to the missing compiler.

Any help would be spectacular. I real want to get started with the GUI.

Thanks.
fields.summary: OMPL install. CCX compiler not found

fields.description: It would be great if we could assign different colors to components in the issue tracker to make it easier to get an overview of the issues raised.
fields.summary: Assign colors to components (BB-10729)

fields.description:
Pull requests intermittently do not close automatically as a result of a local merge/push

To reproduce:

* Create a pull request
* Merge the two branches locally
* Push the merge to Bitbucket
* Observe the PR is still open
* Then push a new commit into the repo as another user
* Observe it is now closed, also the person who closed it is the second pusher
fields.summary: Automatic closing of PRs on pushed merges is not working intermittently (BB-10727)

fields.description:
I am getting a warning that my repository is over 1GB. When this warning is shown, it pushes down the entire content of the page to where the side panel content ends.

It looks like a css issue, .aui-message-banner has a clear:both which is pushing it down below the sidebar.
fields.summary: Repository warning causes layout error (BB-10744)

fields.description:
With the new design, it takes three clicks to reach the admin page.

Share -> Repository Tab -> Manage this repository

It was particularly difficult to find this because "share" doesn't seem to be the natural place to look for general administrative tasks.

There should be a link either as a direct link in the side bar or in the "actions" submenu, which is where I looked for it first.
fields.summary: Link to admin page is buried

fields.description:
My twitter account is connected as "None" and there is no way to remove or reconnect it.

See Issue BCLOUD-7738 item I added April 16, 2014. Thanks.
fields.summary: Issue #7738 *NOT* resolved. Cannot (re)connect twitter from 'None'

fields.description:
I was trying to import some of my GitHub projects, but they simply don't appear in the list at https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/github

I already noticed that you can't import projects from your organization (which is really frustrating), but these are projects owned by myself and they still don't show up.

It seems to me like the list simply stops at some point and the end of it is missing.

You can see my public repositories at https://github.com/oliversalzburg?tab=repositories, but the last entry in the importer is my fork of rsync-time-machine.
fields.summary: GitHub Importer does not list all available projects

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to view an entire repository at a specific commit is to navigate to a specific commit (i.e. https://bitbucket.org/myorg/myproj/commits/9cbdd1719a965f59f2feb56cb2eff59d842763a1) and then replace *commits* with *src* in the URL. It would be nice if there was a simple and user friendly way to do this.

In addition, making it more obvious that the user is viewing the repository on a non-main branch would be nice.
fields.summary: View whole repository at a specific commit. (BB-10723)

fields.description:
all the issues api in 1.0 returns 404.

why this is happening?
fields.summary: api 1.0 issues returning 404

fields.description:
The Audit log page currently doesn't log some crucial information on the shared workspaces, such as:
 # Membership actions
 # Clones, Pushes, and downloads along with the IP address from where it is happening.
 # Updates in  the workspaces or repositories
 # Fork creation
 # Content transfer.
 # Security features enabled/disabled

[~fstefanelli@atlassian.com] edit - It would be great to add project information (who created a project, when it was last updated, show any project changes.

[~lmontiel@atlassian.com] edit - It would be also great to add information related to branch permission changes, showing who altered/created/deleted branch permissions on any given repo.
Please add this logging to the account Audit log.

For example, when an invitation to join a workspace is sent, there is no log stating when the invitation was sent nor who sent the invitation.
fields.summary: Add additional information to account audit log (BB-10722)

fields.description: tytuyiuiyuiyioi
fields.summary: Bugs1

fields.description:
When you have a bunch of repositories, having the repositories sorted by last modification date is pretty a nightmare.

It should be possible to select the sort method (alphabetical, last modification, etc.)
fields.summary: Allow sorting of dashboard repo list by alpha in addition to last modified (BB-10721)

fields.description:
I tried to clone a repository this afternoon (many hours ago now). When I try to open it, it just shows me the cloning repository page forever. I can't seem to delete it either.

The repository is https://bitbucket.org/azelma/cloud-hw6
fields.summary: Stuck on Cloning Repository page

fields.description: When I click eye icon in issues list I have doubled popup alert with text {{You are now watching issue #X.}}. The same issue is when I unwatch issue but the message is "You are no longer watching issue #X."
fields.summary: Double alert about watching issue
Allow sorting of repo search results by last updated date (BB-10716)

fields.description:
We used to have a "Report issue" link, but we got inundated with issues for projects hosted on Bitbucket, not for the Bitbucket website itself.

We should consider having some sort of more prominent "Feedback" link/button because site/master can be hard to find.
fields.summary: Add general "Feedback" button (BB-10715)

fields.description: If I commit code with a JIRA issue id in the commit message (such as "gs-1111") bit bucket will not properly link the id unless it is capitalized ("GS-1111"). The linkage code should probably be made case-insensitive.
fields.summary: Linked JIRA issues in commit message are case sensitive (BB-10710)

fields.description:
Before, the description was shown on the repository detail screen. In the new version, the description is gone. When you have admin rights, you can find the description in the settings of the repository, but a lot of our employees does not have admin rights. We used the description for very useful internal information.

For new repositories we will use the readme.md files, but for our older repositories we have this issue.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Feature request: show description on repository details (BB-10712)

fields.description: Write "Press escape to skip" when any button is pressed during the intro.
fields.summary: Intro movie is not obvious to cancel

fields.description: I always sort by version. Each time I create/view an issue and then come back to the overview I have to click the version box twice to get back my previous setting. It would be great if this state can be saved persistently.
fields.summary: Sort order is not saved in issues overview (BB-10709)

fields.description:
For example when I'm on the issues page and want to create a new issue I accidentally always hit the CREATE button on the top, instead of the less obvious + Create issue.

You don't really create new repositories every day, and in the Repositories pop up menu you can already create new ones, so I think this is a bit overrated!?
fields.summary: CREATE button in status bar confusing (BB-10707)

fields.description: Is there no longer a way to create a team with an academic plan? Before I could do it by adding an academic email address to a team. But now that one cannot add email addresses to teams, I don't see a way to make a team academic.
fields.summary: Unable to create academic team

fields.description:
On overview of repository in recent activity it shows my push, saying: "5 commits\\
Pushed to xhunterx/Unit". I have pushed 10 commits at once. It also shows 5 commits in the list and "+5 more..." at the bottom. It should count all commits in the push, not only the previewed one.
fields.summary: Commits count in push (BB-10708)

fields.description: Branch was deleted after merging pull request. But anyway I can see it in branches table. When I click on ... and delete btn, I see Error modal window 'Failed to delete branch_name'.
fields.summary: Deleted branch is visible in 'branches' table after merged pull request (BB-10713)

fields.description:
i miss the github search feature that lets you sort by "recently updated". it´s a nice feature to implement because it will let you filter all the old/decapricated repos

i would get rid of the "Connect Bitbucket with..." *misleading* icon on the top left corner. The first five times i thought it expanded some menu...

also, a feedback button somewhere would be nice. i'm fairly new to bitbucket and finding this site/master/issues was kind of a pain in the back
fields.summary: new features

fields.description:
According to the documentation of PUT a repository update at

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/repository+Resource+1.0#repositoryResource1.0-PUTarepositoryupdate

name is an optional parameter denoting user-visible name of the repository.

But the PUT action changes the repo_slug
fields.summary: PUT a repository update - changing display name changes repo_slug

fields.description:
Hi,

My repo (chromium_for_android) was marked as read-only because it exceeds the 2GB limit.

This was a mistake and I'd like to delete the repo and start over.

But I cannot delete the repo because it is in read-only mode.

Help?
fields.summary: Cannot delete read-only repository (BB-10704)

fields.description:
Can't delete a repo w/out it, don't see any other links.

Documentation references version before redesign, which did have the gear icon. No help there.

Which means I also can't change the Repository owner... which means I can't deploy to my team.

Oh... so settings are now in lower left in soft-contrast. Nevermind. Why didn't I see it there?
fields.summary: Bitbucket repos no longer have settings icon

fields.description:
A bunch of our pull request have been declined without anyone on the team doing that.

The activity view for those pull requests doesn't show a record for anyone having declined the issue. Other issues that were previously declined do show a declined record.

This seems to have started 2 days ago (2014-05-28). I haven't figured out what might be triggering it.

This should take you right to the evidence: https://bitbucket.org/coursepark/coursepark/pull-requests?displaystatus=declined
fields.summary: Pull Request Declined Spontaneously (BB-10791)

fields.description:
Hi, we have a repo, https://bitbucket.org/rbraswell/afolu_ccalc

And it now displays this message:\\
This repository's size is over 1 GB. Read more on how to reduce the size of your repository.

As well as reports the repo size to be 1.4GB. However, when I run this:

git count-objects -v -H I get\\
size-pack: 141.88 MiB

How can this be?
fields.summary: Reported repository size seems wrong

fields.description:
When viewing a large pull request, the new sidebar menu has very slow responses to hover and click events on Chrome, when it's in its collapsed (icon-only) state.

This is vaguely reminiscent of issue BCLOUD-8741, but I don't know if it's related at all.
fields.summary: Collapsed menu very slow to respond when viewing large pull requests on Chrome (BB-10703)

fields.description:
(Apologies if this is a duplicate FR, but searching issues with 'wiki readme' got no hits.)

I have several fairly-complex scientific-computing projects where the "home page" content (typically gotten from {{./README.*}}) would duplicate top-level wiki content contained in {{./wiki/Home.*}}. On such pages I do something like

{code}
https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o
> Go here; apologies for the extra click.
{code}

where "here"==link to https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/Home

I'm guessing I'm not alone in this usecase--does that seem reasonable? If so, why not enable such an option in project setup/configuration? E.g., if the user chooses to create a project wiki, give the user the option for project homepage content to pull from {{./wiki/Home}} xor {{./README}}.
fields.summary: enable project homepage content to pull from ./wiki/Home (BB-10702)

fields.description:
Hi,

I just created a new repository but can't do anything about it since Settings doesn't show up.\\
This is not a problem with my existing or old repositories, only for newly created ones.

Thanks,

Grace
fields.summary: Settings doesn't show up for newly created repository

fields.description:
The dashboard overview page has 4 filters:

* All
* Watching
* Mine
* Team

It would be great to have a filter showing all the project which aren't owned by myself (the All, Watching and Mine view all contain my own projects).
fields.summary: Dashboard overview: have a view without my own projects (BB-10701)

fields.description: I feel like a nice feature of the BitBucket API would be to offer a way to comment on existing pull requests. Forgive me if this issue already exists, but it would be endlessly useful (as opposed to having to scrape the PR's and post a comment that way).
fields.summary: Ability to post Pull Request comments via API

fields.description:
When viewing commit history on a file, second column of data is the commit hash with a link.

When opening the page with the commit, the file which history I was viewing is displayed in state it had when that commit was made. Is there a way to open that page so that diff view is opened by default instead of the source view? If not, can there be an option for it?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Open diff view by default when viewing commits from file history page (BB-10700)

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket support,

Our team account: Xinguard, is reported:\\
This repository is currently unavailable.\\
for all repositories.\\
https://bitbucket.org/xinguard/

I have no idea how it happens.

Can you please help us?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Repositories are currently unavailable for our Team account

fields.description:
Forgive me, for being rude, but I'm really frustrated. Guys, when you're going to grow up?

Do we (users) really have to tell you, that there is *an absolute need* for adding any kind of warning, that user is about to close browser / tab with unsaved changes in online editor? Is it to hard to figure out such basic, fundamental and obvious things yourself among dev team?

I've just lost about an hour of my work, because I had open four online editors for my wiki in four separate tabs and accidentally closed entire browser window. Since you haven't implemented yet any warning / security prompt, all unsaved changes were just lost.

I was shocked and terrified to find out, that you have no such thing implemented. What is it, after all, a professional tool or a joke? How old a Bitbucket is, that it still hasn't got something such obvious implemented? Grow up and give us *usable* tool!
fields.summary: And onClose / onBeforeUnload warning for unsaved wiki edits (BB-10699)

fields.description: Before the design change clicking the "Clone" button used to give a small block with a clone command you could copy. It currently does not work under Firefox 29.0 or Chronium (and probably Google Chrome)
fields.summary: "Clone in SourceTree" button broken (BB-10694)
Bitbucket issue keys do not show up in Bitbucket issue tracker when in a Git commit message

fields.description:
# Need to easily drag and drop image when creating issue.\\
Like gmail.\\
Not just attached image and have all images listed on the top.
# Need to be able to put images in between lines
# Might want to consider a floating "FEEDBACK" button for easy feedback\\
----> check google for business\\
----> Automate feedback to create issue in https://bitbucket.org/site/master/
fields.summary: feature requests

fields.description: When I click 'fork' on a mercurial repo, bitbucket helpfully informs me that I could create a patch queue instead. Since I'm not sure what the implications of that would be, I click the documentation link right next to the form, only to be asked to create an Atlassian ID (don't I already have one, being logged into bitbucket), and then the page turns out to be locked down so I can't see it. What gives?
fields.summary: Patch Queue Documentation restricted

fields.description:
We don't like to merge branches into master without reviewing the merged output before the merge.\\
So our flow for merging branches is as follows:

# A feature branch is approved (pull request needs to be merged)
# git merge --ff-only
# If merge failed, switch to the feature branch and merge from master, wait for approval of pull request with the additional merge commit, start over

But it seems that there's no way to block a merge of pull requests in BitBucket, only if there's a merge conflict.\\
Personally I use BitBucket and is happy with it, but unfortunately this collaboration feature is a showstopper for us in using BitBucket in our company.
fields.summary: Force fast-forward only merges when targeting specific branches

fields.description:
it would be nice to have a default template for branch management so when you create a new repo, it already has the standards for your team and common settings.

This would save a lot of time when creating new repos and less of a learning curve when new devs join the team.
fields.summary: Branch Management Template/Defaults (BB-10698)

fields.description:
Currently the Jenkins hook triggers for all commits and this is a bit troublesome for when using Git Flow and feature branches.

Please allow to specify for which branch the hook is enabled so that we can monitor commits only for develop branch for example.
fields.summary: Allow to specify a branch for which the Jenkins hook is used

fields.description:
In repository issues view, all keyboard shortcuts are working as expected, except

"[" - Collapse/expand side bar

On the same machine with the same browser and same keyboard setup this shortcut is working fine in Atlassian's JIRA on demand.

MAC mini, 64bit, Mavericks 10.9.3.\\
Safari 7.0.4, German keyboard. ("[" is option-5).

Workaround: change the keyboard to an English variant and press "ü". This workaround is not satisfactory, as changing the keyboard layout just for this shortcut to work is not practical.
fields.summary: Collapse/expand side bar shortcut not working on Mac in some keyboard layouts

fields.description:
Hi there,

I am the admin of a repository (https://bitbucket.org/jasdeepkhalsa/code/) and I could not see the settings cog icon for it anywhere on the dashboard as it was described in your documentation.

I managed to somehow find a link to the repo admin settings (https://bitbucket.org/jasdeepkhalsa/code/admin/access), but that cog icon was no where to be seen.

If I'm seeing this issue, perhaps many others are experiencing the same issue and getting confused?

My browser is Google Chrome on Linux - Version 34.0.1847.137. Apologies I did not take a screenshot of my dashboard before deleting my repository.
fields.summary: As an admin I cannot see the settings cog for my repo

fields.description:
Can't find any link to repository settings on new site design.\\
This bug is on the all of my repositories.

Warm regards,\\
Vadim.
fields.summary: Access to repository settings

fields.description:
Attached is the current layout. I have been clicking the "Create" (repository) almost every single time I want to create a new issue.

As a user this means I am not comfortable with the current UI placement.

Placing the + Create Issue button right under the header *Issues* would be an immediate solution. I really doubt any user would want move their mouse cursor all the way to the right end of the page. Human eyes catch the center. The current button for creating issue is not visible to users either. That's why I and possibly other humans click on the Create button up there.

The reason why Github's button is fine even though it is already on the right end page is that the button is more noticeable, the page is center (eyes can easily spot that green button) and create new repo button is not right above "Issues".
fields.summary: Please move the Create Issue button from right end of the page to left

fields.description:
I use the [Git Flow workflow|https://www.atlassian.com/git/workflows#%21workflow-gitflow] and all features start from the develop branch.

Please make the Originating branch (develop) the "destination" branch for merge activities. This will prevent people (authorised peeps like me!) merging to the wrong branch.
fields.summary: Sticky Destination for Branch (BB-10697)

fields.description: When scrolling down, the sidebar gets the .aui-is-docked class, which adds position: fixed; to keep the sidebar in place.  This works fine until another page is loaded (apparently via AJAX).  If the page is too short to enable the scrollbar, or before scrolling, the sidebar will be over the top of the navbar, since it doesn't lose the .aui-is-docked class until it's removed by an onScroll event. See the attached screenshot for an example.
fields.summary: Sidebar remains docked after pjax page load (BB-10736)

fields.description:
**User Story: **

Isabelle the Issue commentor has added valuable information to an issue. Vern the voter has voted on this issue as well. Both are now subscribed to get updates.

Victor the vaccuous commentor and 50 more like him, comment: "+1!" being either unaware of voting, unaware that he's spamming the entire list, or uninterested in the annoyance it causes.

Isabelle, and Vern are annoyed and decide to stop participating.

*Potential solutions:*

* It would be nice to be able to automatically block, filter, or moderate comments which match a certain pattern to avoid the spam.
* Alternatively it might work to warn users:

** when commenting and the watch list is over a certain size "_comment will be sent to 103 people, are you sure you want to post_?"
** as they type if they use certain phrases including "+1" that are considered noise: "_+1 no longer functions for voting. Please use the vote functionality instead_"
fields.summary: Filter out "+1" messages from issue streams

fields.description:
How do I change the repository user management?!?!?!....\\
I searched for that allover, nothing intuitively there, please update your online documentation, which is more a sort of an overgrown jungle, it takes ages until you find what you need!!! Besides this it's anyway outdated. Great service, thanks.
fields.summary: You changed the Bitbucket interface, but did not update your documentation at all

fields.description: Hi there i imported a repository into my account by accident, instead of my team. I then imported the repository into the team, but i just want to delete the repository that is still in my account. I can't seem to find a way of doing it.
fields.summary: Import repository

fields.description:
I'm allowing anonymous users to post issues, since the hassle of making an account is a bit of an annoyance to post bugs with.\\
But some time around, people will start taking advantage of that situation, thus for the repository's full admins, I want to be able to see the anonymous user's IP address so I can trace him back on my own forums or servers.

Please get this done, it'd help me a lot.
fields.summary: Show IP for anonymous issues

fields.description:
Client IP only shows the IP in which the sign in originated from.\\
There is no data on current/latest IP.
fields.summary: Sessions view only shows the IP address at time of login/logout (BB-10672)

fields.description:
How can OAuth consumers creation & deletion not be audited?\\
Everything else on team/account settings is audited.
fields.summary: Add audit log entries for changes to OAuth consumers (BB-10683)

fields.description:
As a user it would be convenient to have the Checkout dropdown button on the Pull Request page so as to avoid having to jump to the branch page.

Small improvement but its a common workflow for our team to checkout PR and boostrap their env and review the code in their editors. If there are small errors they just fix them and contribute back to the branch / PR rather than wasting time adding comments for trivial things to fix.
fields.summary: Add checkout button on Pull Request page (BB-10681)

fields.description: I'm not receiving my password reset email - admin@play2lead.com.au
fields.summary: Not receiving password reset email

fields.description:
Uploading two files with the same name to the Downloads page results in a collision: Bitbucket will list both files, but when one file is deleted, trying to download the other will result in an HTTP 404 error, despite the link still existing on the Downloads page.

The behavior should be made consistent: either uploads of the same name should overwrite both the file and the link on the Downloads page, or multiple uploads of the same name should result in distinct Download links on the Downloads page and distinct files.
fields.summary: Two downloads of the same name collide incorrectly (BB-10684)
test issue

fields.description:
In Java, projects often have directories with dig depths because of the name spacing in Java. For instance, if my project is called powerBucket and I created it, the namespace will be: de.matt3o12.powerBucket. Java requires me to put all my classes with that namespace into "de/matt3o12/powerBucket". So, the project hierarchy will look like this:

{code}
src/
	de/
		matt3o12/
			powerBucket/
				MyClass.java
				... other classes
	
{code}

Navigating to MyClass.java in bitbucket can really be a hassle. All folders (except powerBucket) are often empty or just contain some unimportant files.

Since navigation to MyClass (especially with slow internet) is very time consuming, it would be nice if I could access the subdirectory powerBucket directly.\\
Jenkins provides a decent way to do so. When a folder contains a subfolder (and only one), it displays all subfolder next to the main folder. I attached 2 screenshots what it looks like in Jenkins and how it could look in bitbucket (I manipulated the HTML).
fields.summary: Improve source browser navigation for deeply nested directory structures (BB-10686)

fields.description:
The new left-side icon menu is a usability disaster. I don't know what any of these cryptic icons are and I don't expect I'll ever learn. Accessing the labels is inconvenient because on my main development machine it requires a click just to see what I'm doing, and once it comes up it occludes content (I tried on another computer with a larger monitor and the side menu auto-expanded, which is better, but doesn't help _me_. There seems to be no pattern which items are given icons and which items are hidden under the wastebasket "..." menu.

"Press [ to expand menu", is, I am serious, probably the *weirdest UX decision I have ever seen on a website". The only kind of software I think anyone would consider that sensible in is a command-line curses app. This is a website.

Expected behavior: Site navigation and actions should be accessible by labeled buttons or links which are visible at all times. Labels are more important than icons (because I know what "Pull Requests" means but I don't know what a box with an arrow in it is). If putting the buttons on the left side of the screen forces you to shrink those buttons until they are just incomprehensible icons, then this means you should not have put the buttons on the left side of the screen.

Marking "major" because if people who come to my site cannot find important verbs like "clone" or "issues" because they are hidden behind easy-to-overlook hieroglyphs, I will have to consider moving my files off Bitbucket. This is a site-breaking issue from my perspective.
fields.summary: New left-side icon menu is totally unusable (BB-10696)

fields.description:
Since the redesign, on most pages I see a huge sidebar box labeled "recent activity". I have no reason or desire to look at this, yet it is taking up most of the space on the screen. You should offer the ability to hide this, or at least.

Maybe if you weren't wasting all that space on "recent activity", you could actually show the site controls on the left side of the screen. Why is "recent activity" considered more important than _any_ of the UI verbs, such it needs several times more screen space?

Marking as "major" as this seriously impacts site usability on small screens such as the one on my laptop.
fields.summary: Need ability to hide "Recent activity" sidebar

fields.description:
The "description" field in Settings is no longer shown anywhere on my project pages after the new redesign. Instead there is a message admonishing me to create a README. This is not acceptable.

I do not intend to create a file named README or, if I do, it will not be for display on Bitbucket. I do not want my README files shown on the project page. My "description" fields are Bitbucket-specific descriptions and as the file host you don't get to dictate the contents of my repositories.

I need the "description" field displayed when it is set.

Marking as "bug" because you are hiding content I have set from users. Marking as "major" because I have description set on many of my project pages and you have just broken the presentation of all of these at once.
fields.summary: Consider displaying repository description somewhere other than search results (BB-10690)

fields.description: When in a repository, the Settings links at the bottom left corner of the screen gets half-hidden under the "mouse-over link text" that shows up in Chrome. I had a hard time locating the settings for repository. Especially because the Settings link ends up even lower than the footer text (the Atlassian logo) making you feel that there is nothing below that!
fields.summary: Repository settings link half-hidden (Chrome Windows)

fields.description:
Hi,

I have the [fancyBox plugin|http://fancyapps.com/fancybox/] for my portfolio gallery. I recently updated it to the latest version, and it just doesn't work really when I test my repo:  http://jaminroe.bitbucket.org/. I also have to click on the thumbnail at least two times, to get it to popup.

Not sure what it is, but it sucks because I can't reliably test it now. Screenshot attached showing how it looks, and how it _SHOULD_ look.

Thanks so much!
fields.summary: Bitbucket doesn't like fancybox

fields.description: Crear la grafica de flujo
fields.summary: Grafica de flujo

fields.description: Basarse en la grafica de pay del sistema anterior
fields.summary: Crear grafica de actas

fields.description:
The sample below creates an indented list of both ordered (numbered) and unordered items, as might be useful in a requirements template, when rendered using the Markdown tool at http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/dingus. When rendered within the BitBucket wiki, however, it creates a rather unordered list (some of the indented items are inline, the numbering continues where it shouldn't, etc).

(BitBucket sample is available at https://bitbucket.org/ab-iteam/tutorial/wiki/Markdown%20Sample)

{code}
## General Requirements
*TODO* An important note goes here.

1. blah blah
 * detailed blah blah
 * more details blah blah
2. blah another blah
3. blah very complex blah
  1. blah detail blah 
  2. blah blah blah
     *Note* very important information
  3. blah blah
    * blah blah
    * blah blah
      * blah blah blah
      * blah blah blah
      * blah blah blah
    * blah blah

# Apendix A: Terminology and Context
This section is to explain any language above that may not be clear.
{code}
fields.summary: Wiki Markdown lists are not being rendered correctly

fields.description:
With GitHub, I can write a commit message like {{Create controllers for BCLOUD-1.}} and this would add a comment to the issue with a link back to the changeset.

The current behavior is inconsistent because a link to the issue is created in the commit message but there is link to the commit in the issue. It's very frustrating.

According to [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Resolve%2Bissues%2Bautomatically%2Bwhen%2Busers%2Bpush%2Bcode#Resolveissuesautomaticallywhenuserspushcode-IncludingIssuesinaCommitMessage], we must use:

* addresses
* re
* references
* ref
* refs
* see
fields.summary: Add comments to issues referenced in commit messages with a link to the commit (BB-10682)

fields.description:
Please disable that annoying fade-in animation when user clicks button 'Side-by-side diff' and fade-out animation when user closes that modal. Each time I do CR for one file you take 1 second from life of developer.

Stop being fancybox-like.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Consider removing animations that prevent users from interacting with the site (BB-10678)

fields.description:
The branch information on the commit detail page is removed since the release of the new layout. With the old layout it was possible to see in which branches a commit was merged.

Can you please bring back this feature?
fields.summary: Branches are removed from commit page

fields.description:
I'm using plugin jetbrains-bitbucket-connector_PC-133.881 with PyCharm 3.1.3. I get the message "Can't login to BitBucket" when I click the Test button of the BitBucket configuration screen. No joy with password, password-protected RSA key, or unprotected RSA key. However login via git-bash works fine with either key.\\
I'm happy to provide additional documentation but I'm new to PyCharm and not familiar with logging modes, log file locations, etc.\\
I classify the defect as major because it prevents the use of BitBucket with PyCharm. However, if there's a workaround (I haven't found one) I'd concur that the defect should be rated lower--perhaps much lower.\\
Cheers.
fields.summary: BitBucket Plugin for PyCharm: Can't Login

fields.description:
When working with a lot of branches (e.g. customer branches), syncing becomes quite time-consuming since you have to click Edit>Sync for each of those branches and for each branch you have to wait half a minute to complete.

It would be great to have an option for syncing multiple branches with "one click".

E.g. select multiple branches with a checkbox and then Edit>Sync
fields.summary: Ability to sync multiple branches at one time (BB-10663)

fields.description:
I need to delete a private repository under my account.\\
Strictly delete - not update for later use.\\
I need to clean up the account such that its repositories are the only active ones.

But following:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Delete+a+repository

I cannot see the repository's (gear symbol) settings icon (far right-hand side of screen).

So I can't delete the repository.

I am the owner and admin of the repositories I would like to delete.

I've tried and failed using the ff. browser versions:

* Chromium Version 34.0.1847.116 Ubuntu 12.04 (260972)
* Mozilla Firefox 27.0 for Ubuntu canonical - 1.0
fields.summary: Cannot delete repository in Chromium and Mozilla Firefox

fields.description:
On my dashboard, I still see repos which at one time I had access to, and was watching.  I no longer have any access to them, however, so they should not show up.

I see them under the All, Watching, and Team links/lists.
fields.summary: Users can still see repositories that they were watching on the dashboard even after their access is removed (BB-10677)

fields.description: I want to give someone access to a private repository. I don't know whether or not they have a BitBucket account. When I add them by email address, I get the message, "You cannot grant a team access to a repository." I'm not trying to grant a team access, and I don't know whether or not this person has received my invitation.
fields.summary: can't grant access to user by email address

fields.description:
Attempting to add a comment to Issue 9549.

Cicking on "Comment" leaves the page in eternal update.  The comment is not saved:

!2618968656-bitbucket9553.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Tracker : Can't add comment to other person's issue

fields.description: When trying to upload a logo to a new repo, I get a broken image icon in my browser. When I try to open the image source location, I get an xml response: {code} AccessDenied Access Denied 6E449F78CC86D6FF XM4IGiVuJAxFBuVBZ0CsOxdlWYy+x21HBxMegCPMTYGiBwI7iw3o9uHZcMTCVWlc {code}
fields.summary: Repo Logo Update Broken

fields.description:
Please could a Bitbucket snippet hosting service be produced, complete with a very simple(ideally {{http auth}} based) API, support for multiple files in a single snippet,and super-simple sharing and forking.

Other potential extensions to this feature could be:

* HTML Snippet hosting(Akin to the user.Bitbucket.org hosting, i.e. {{snippet-id.bitsnippet.org}})
* Git Access
* Clean and simple web editor interface.
* Markdown support
* (Far-fetched?) Compilation/Testing of code, similar to [IdeOne|http://ideone.com/]

I would really appreciate this feature, especially if hosting was available. I respect that I may be asking a large amount, but I feel this feature would be a great help, and a great fit with the Bitbucket platform.
fields.summary: Snippet Hosting

fields.description:
See https://bitbucket.org/rstanchak/readme-issue for an example

The REAME.md links to page.md and subdirectory/page.md...

Thus, I expect the links in the overview page to refer to\\
https://bitbucket.org/rstanchak/readme-issue/page.md\\
and\\
https://bitbucket.org/rstanchak/readme-issue/subdirectory/page.md

however, the actual links are to\\
https://bitbucket.org/rstanchak/page.md\\
and\\
https://bitbucket.org/rstanchak/subdirectory/page.md

The repository component seems to have been truncated.

Viewing the README directly in source view renders the expected urls.
fields.summary: README rendering in overview and directory generates incorrect links

fields.description:
Hi,

I created a new directory under my existing git repo

mkdir mydir

then I did

git add mydir/

git commit -m "msg"

git push

----
but the mydir does not show in source although the commit and push were succesful

what is this issue?
fields.summary: New directory not visible in source

fields.description: Hi, I need you to know that I just lost 15 minutes trying to find where you put the repository settings button (the cog) in the new design... obviously this little gray button is at a very wrong place ! Thank you anyway for this service
fields.summary: Repository settings icon is not very discoverable (BB-10659)
